  1. # -*- coding: utf-8 -*-
  2. from cms.toolbar.base import BaseItem, Serializable
  3. from django.conf import settings
  4. from django.core.exceptions import ImproperlyConfigured
  5. from django.middleware.csrf import get_token
  6. from django.template.context import RequestContext, Context
  7. from django.template.loader import render_to_string
  8. from django.utils.html import strip_spaces_between_tags
  11. class Switcher(BaseItem):
  12. """
  13. A 'switcher' button, state is defined using GET (and optionally a session
  14. entry).
  15. """
  16. item_type = 'switcher'
  17. extra_attributes = [
  18. ('add_parameter', 'addParameter'),
  19. ('remove_parameter', 'removeParameter'),
  20. ('title', 'title'),
  21. ]
  23. def __init__(self, alignment, css_class_suffix, add_parameter,
  24. remove_parameter, title, session_key=None):
  25. """
  26. add_parameter: parameter which indicates the True state
  27. remove_parameter: parameter which indicates the False state
  28. title: name of the switcher
  29. session_key: key in the session which has a boolean value to indicate
  30. the state of this switcher.
  31. """
  32. super(Switcher, self).__init__(alignment, css_class_suffix)
  33. self.add_parameter = add_parameter
  34. self.remove_parameter = remove_parameter
  35. self.title = title
  36. self.session_key = session_key
  38. def get_state(self, request):
  39. state = self.add_parameter in request.GET
  40. if self.session_key and request.session.get(self.session_key, False):
  41. return True
  42. return state
  45. def get_extra_data(self, context, toolbar, **kwargs):
  46. return {
  47. 'state': self.get_state(toolbar.request)
  48. }
  51. class Anchor(BaseItem):
  52. """
  53. A link.
  54. """
  55. item_type = 'anchor'
  56. extra_attributes = [
  57. ('url', 'url'),
  58. ('title', 'title'),
  59. ]
  61. def __init__(self, alignment, css_class_suffix, title, url):
  62. """
  63. title: Name of the link
  64. url: Target of the link
  65. """
  66. super(Anchor, self).__init__(alignment, css_class_suffix)
  67. self.title = title
  68. if callable(url):
  69. self.serialize_url = url
  70. else:
  71. self.url = url
  74. class HTML(BaseItem):
  75. """
  76. HTML item, can do whatever it want
  77. """
  78. item_type = 'html'
  79. extra_attributes = [
  80. ('html', 'html'),
  81. ]
  83. def __init__(self, alignment, css_class_suffix, html):
  84. """
  85. html: The HTML to render.
  86. """
  87. super(HTML, self).__init__(alignment, css_class_suffix)
  88. self.html = html
  91. class TemplateHTML(BaseItem):
  92. """
  93. Same as HTML, but renders a template to generate the HTML.
  94. """
  95. item_type = 'html'
  97. def __init__(self, alignment, css_class_suffix, template):
  98. """
  99. template: the template to render
  100. """
  101. super(TemplateHTML, self).__init__(alignment, css_class_suffix)
  102. self.template = template
  104. def get_extra_data(self, context, toolbar, **kwargs):
  105. new_context = RequestContext(toolbar.request)
  106. rendered = render_to_string(self.template, new_context)
  107. stripped = strip_spaces_between_tags(rendered.strip())
  108. return {
  109. 'html': stripped,
  110. }
  113. class GetButton(BaseItem):
  114. """
  115. A button which triggers a GET request
  116. """
  117. item_type = 'button'
  118. extra_attributes = [
  119. ('title', 'title'),
  120. ('icon', 'icon'),
  121. ('url', 'redirect'),
  122. ]
  124. def __init__(self, alignment, css_class_suffix, title, url, icon=None):
  125. """
  126. title: name of the button
  127. icon: icon of the button, relative to STATIC_URL
  128. url: target of the GET request
  129. """
  130. super(GetButton, self).__init__(alignment, css_class_suffix)
  131. self.icon = icon
  132. self.title = title
  133. if callable(url):
  134. self.serialize_url = url
  135. else:
  136. self.url = url
  139. class PostButton(BaseItem):
  140. """
  141. A button which triggers a POST request
  142. """
  143. item_type = 'button'
  144. extra_attributes = [
  145. ('title', 'title'),
  146. ('icon', 'icon'),
  147. ('action', 'action'),
  148. ]
  150. def __init__(self, alignment, css_class_suffix, title, icon, action, *args, **kwargs):
  151. """
  152. title: name of the button
  153. icon: icon of the button, relative to STATIC_URL
  154. action: target of the request
  155. *args, **kwargs: data to POST
  157. A csrfmiddlewaretoken is always injected into the request.
  158. """
  159. super(PostButton, self).__init__(alignment, css_class_suffix)
  160. self.title = title
  161. self.icon = icon
  162. self.action = action
  163. self.args = args
  164. self.kwargs = kwargs
  166. def get_extra_data(self, context, toolbar, **kwargs):
  167. double = self.kwargs.copy()
  168. double['csrfmiddlewaretoken'] = get_token(toolbar.request)
  169. hidden = render_to_string('cms/toolbar/items/_post_button_hidden.html',
  170. Context({'single': self.args,
  171. 'double': double}))
  172. return {
  173. 'hidden': hidden,
  174. }
  177. class ListItem(Serializable):
  178. """
  179. A item in a dropdown list (List).
  180. """
  181. base_attributes = [
  182. ('css_class', 'cls'),
  183. ('title', 'title'),
  184. ('url', 'url'),
  185. ('icon', 'icon'),
  186. ('method', 'method'),
  187. ]
  188. extra_attributes = []
  190. def __init__(self, css_class_suffix, title, url, method='GET', icon=None):
  191. """
  192. title: name of the list
  193. url: target of the item
  194. icon: icon of the item, relative to STATIC_URL
  195. """
  196. self.css_class_suffix = css_class_suffix
  197. self.css_class = 'cms_toolbar-item_%s' % self.css_class_suffix
  198. self.title = title
  199. self.method = method
  200. self.icon = icon
  201. if callable(url):
  202. self.serialize_url = url
  203. else:
  204. self.url = url
  207. class List(BaseItem):
  208. """
  209. A dropdown list
  210. """
  211. item_type = 'list'
  212. extra_attributes = [
  213. ('title', 'title'),
  214. ('icon', 'icon'),
  215. ]
  217. def __init__(self, alignment, css_class_suffix, title, icon, items):
  218. """
  219. title: name of the item
  220. icon: icon of the item, relative to STATIC_URL
  221. items: an iterable of ListItem instances.
  222. """
  223. super(List, self).__init__(alignment, css_class_suffix)
  224. self.title = title
  225. self.icon = icon
  226. self.validate_items(items)
  227. self.raw_items = items
  229. def validate_items(self, items):
  230. for item in items:
  231. if not isinstance(item, ListItem):
  232. raise ImproperlyConfigured(
  233. 'Only ListItem instances are allowed to be used inside of '
  234. 'List instances'
  235. )
  237. def get_extra_data(self, context, **kwargs):
  238. items = [item.serialize(context, **kwargs)
  239. for item in self.raw_items]
  240. return {
  241. 'items': items
  242. }
